name: Weathery
blurb: View the weather in gifs. This project was my exercise in raw Javascript for doing API requests in AJAX.

name: Fifty Two
blurb: A web page built in Angular to house my 52 week code project. The fact that you're looking at this means I was successful in building my first Angular app! One of my goals is to get comfortable with the MEAN stack (MongoDB, Express, Angular, Node), so learning Angular is my first step towards that goal.

name: Messengerbot
blurb: Messengerbot! I built this guy as an exercise in Angular and CSS animations. It's not very usable, but it's still cute and fun to look at. There's a lot of stuff I want to implement, and I might just implement them it throughout the week. Enjoy!

name: Eightball
blurb: I built this little project as an exercise in CSS animations and JS. You can also shake it to activate it - that's one small thing I learned that I can easily reuse.

name: Key Fighter
blurb: This is something inspired by the practice mode in fighting games like streetfighter. Press some keys, create a combo, and enjoy some sound effects!

name: Peeps
blurb: This is a dummy Angular app I made following the Codeschool Angular course. I did this as a way to practice the Angular concepts covered in the course, including controllers, directives, custom directives, and http service. The CSS is ugly, but the main purpose is to practice Angular.

name: Roll-a-ball
blurb: I took a stab at the popular Unity game engine, following the beginner's tutorial. It was fun, and here's the end result. Next, I want to extend its functionality beyond what was shown in the tutorial.
